lines.text: P = power, F = force, v = velocity

secText: Power can also be calculated as a function of force and velocity. When the force and velocity are constant, and in the same direction, the power equals the force times velocity.

If the force is constant, but not in the same direction as the velocity, the cosine of the angle between the two vectors can be used to calculate the component of the force acting in the direction of the velocity.
